newsitem.title: FRANCE: Strauss-Kahn sees positive outcome in Renault row.
newsitem.headline: Strauss-Kahn sees positive outcome in Renault row.

text.p: French Economy Minister Dominique Strauss-Kahn said he foresaw a positive outcome to the dispute over automaker Renault SA's intention to close down its Vilvorde factory in Belgium.

Asked by reporters after a two-hour meeting with Prime Minister Lionel Jospin what sort of an outcome he saw to the dispute, Strauss-Kahn replied: "A positive outcome." He gave no details or further comment.

Demonstrations followed Renault's announcement in February that it would close the factory, which employs 3,100 people, but Jospin said during France's general election campaign he would review the issue if he came to power.
Jospin aides have been in contact with Renault over the past few days and say Renault should disclose results of the talks, possibly on Tuesday.
